1.description: Victor of the 74th Hunger Games, struggling with PTSD and President Snow's threats.
Co-victor trying to protect Katniss while maintaining their fake romance.

11.description: Charismatic and popular victor from District 4, known for his charm and skill with a trident.

17.description: Demonstrates survival skills and loyalty by staying with Mags and helping the alliance.

26.description: Reveals he has been part of the underground rebellion all along, working to protect Katniss.

11.description: Fierce victor from District 7 who hates the Capitol.

15.description: Brilliant inventor from District 3, specializes in electrical engineering.

24.description: Devises the plan to use lightning and wire to destroy the arena's force field.

15.description: Intelligent but traumatized victor from District 3, often appears confused but has moments of clarity.

22.description: Reveals the arena's clock pattern by repeatedly saying 'tick tock', helping the alliance understand the threats.

23.description: Killed by Gloss during the attack at the Cornucopia while trying to help her allies.

11.description: Elderly victor from District 4, Finnick's mentor.

7.description: New Head Gamemaker who replaced Seneca Crane.

27.description: Revealed to be a leader of the rebellion who orchestrated the arena escape.

11.description: Male victor from District 1, brother to Cashmere. Known for his ruthless nature.
Female victor from District 1, sister to Gloss. Beautiful and deadly.
Large, intimidating male victor from District 2. Known for his brutality.
Fierce female victor from District 2, known for her sharpened teeth.

15.description: Male victor from District 5 (power), appears elderly and frail during the Quarter Quell.
Female victor from District 5 (power), appears middle-aged during the Quarter Quell.
Male victor from District 6, addicted to morphling. Known for his artistic camouflage skills.
Female victor from District 6, addicted to morphling. Known for her camouflage abilities.

22.description: Saves Peeta from the monkey mutations by taking a fatal blow meant for him.

11.description: Male victor from District 7, lumber district. Partner to Johanna Mason.

21.description: Dies when he hits the force field around the arena.

11.description: Elderly male victor from District 8, textile district. Half-deaf and gentle.
Female victor from District 8, textile district. Has children back home.

15.description: Male victor from District 9 (grain), appears older during the Quarter Quell tribute parade.
Female victor from District 9 (grain), appears middle-aged during the Quarter Quell.
Male victor from District 10 (livestock), appears sturdy and farm-weathered during the Quarter Quell.
Female victor from District 10 (livestock), appears strong and practical during the Quarter Quell.

11.description: Male victor from District 11, agriculture district. Missing his left hand.
Female victor from District 11, agriculture district. Older and wise.

1.description: Former victor from District 12 and mentor to Katniss and Peeta.

11.description: Revealed to be the third tribute from District 12 in the Quarter Quell, but Peeta volunteers.

27.description: Revealed to be part of the rebel conspiracy to rescue Katniss from the arena.

1.description: District 12's Capitol escort, bubbly but increasingly troubled by the Games.

11.description: Struggles emotionally with having to escort Katniss and Peeta to their likely deaths in the Quarter Quell.

1.description: President of Panem who threatens Katniss and her loved ones.

7.description: Hosts party where he subtly intimidates Katniss while introducing her to Plutarch Heavensbee.

10.description: Announces the Third Quarter Quell to target victors, specifically to eliminate Katniss.

1.description: Katniss's best friend and hunting partner from District 12.

5.description: Publicly whipped by Thread for illegal hunting, showing the Capitol's increased brutality.

8.description: Reveals his anger about the Capitol and desire for armed rebellion against their oppressors.

1.description: Katniss's younger sister, the reason she volunteered for the first Games.
Katniss's mother, a former apothecary who withdrew after her husband's death.

3.description: Young Peacekeeper in District 12 who was friendly to Katniss.

15.description: Revealed to have been turned into an Avox (tongueless servant) as punishment.

7.description: New Head Peacekeeper in District 12, much harsher than his predecessor.

11.description: Katniss's stylist who created the mockingjay dress and other symbolic outfits.

15.description: Beaten by Peacekeepers in front of Katniss before she enters the arena.

11.description: Peeta's stylist for the Quarter Quell.
Victor from District 4 and Finnick's love interest. Went mad during her Games.

12.description: Refugee from District 8 who escaped to the woods after an uprising.
Young refugee from District 8, traveling with Twill through the woods.

8.description: Young female Peacekeeper in District 12, more sympathetic than the others.

1.description: Gale's mother who works as a healer and washerwoman in District 12.
Neighbor who helps watch Prim while Katniss is away.
Friend of Katniss and Gale from District 12, mentioned in conversation.
Friend of Gale from District 12 who hunts and works with him.

5.description: Present during Gale's whipping, showing concern for his friend.

1.description: Peeta's father who runs the bakery in District 12. Kind man who once gave bread to starving Katniss.
Peeta's harsh mother who runs the bakery with her husband. Known for her sharp tongue.
Peeta's two older brothers who work in the family bakery.
Prim's beloved cat, initially disliked by Katniss but tolerated for Prim's sake.
Prim's goat, purchased with Katniss's winnings and provider of milk and cheese.
Hybrid birds that can repeat human songs, created from Capitol jabberjays and mockingbirds.

24.description: Used in the arena's jabberjay attack to replay screams and torture tributes.

27.description: Rebel filmmaker and assistant working with the District 13 rescue operation.

1.description: One of Gale's younger brothers.
One of Gale's younger brothers.
Gale's little sister, the youngest of the Hawthorne children.

8.description: Black market alcohol seller at the Hob who was whipped by Thread.

7.description: Former Head Peacekeeper in District 12, more lenient than his replacement Thread.

1.description: Various traders at the Hob (black market) where Katniss sells game and buys supplies.

8.description: Face increased scrutiny and punishment under Thread's harsh regime.

10.description: Capitol official who announces the Third Quarter Quell rules on television.

9.description: Winners of the previous Quarter Quell Games, including Haymitch from the 50th Games.

21.description: Invisible barrier surrounding the Quarter Quell arena that kills on contact.

26.description: Destroyed by Katniss's arrow and Beetee's wire, causing the arena to collapse.

22.description: Massive tree in the arena that gets struck by lightning at midnight and noon.

18.description: Deadly fog that burns skin on contact, one of the arena's hourly threats.

20.description: Hot blood that falls from the sky in one section of the arena as an hourly threat.
Genetically modified wasps whose stings cause hallucinations and death, released in the arena.

11.description: Additional Capitol stylists and assistants who work with Cinna to prepare Katniss for the Quarter Quell.
Capitol stylists assigned to the other Quarter Quell tributes for interviews and presentation.
Former victors who mentor the Quarter Quell tributes, though their role is complicated since the tributes are all former winners.

2.description: Peacekeepers stationed in various districts to maintain Capitol control during and after the Victory Tour.

5.description: Become increasingly brutal under orders to suppress growing rebellion in the districts.

2.description: Capitol officials who coordinate and oversee the Victory Tour ceremonies in each district.
Citizens of District 1 who work in luxury goods production and attend Victory Tour ceremony.
Citizens of District 2 who work in masonry and Peacekeeper training, attend Victory Tour.
Citizens of District 3 who work in electronics and technology, attend Victory Tour ceremony.
Citizens of District 4 who work in fishing industry and attend Victory Tour ceremony.

3.description: Citizens of District 11 who work in agriculture and witness the uprising during the Victory Tour.

1.description: Citizens of District 12 including coal miners from the Seam and merchant class families.

5.description: Face increased brutality under Thread's harsh new regime, with public punishments.

16.description: Sandy beach surrounding the Cornucopia island where tributes first land in the Quarter Quell arena.

17.description: Dense tropical jungle that makes up most of the Quarter Quell arena, divided into 12 sections.

16.description: Saltwater that surrounds the Cornucopia island and fills the arena, providing both resource and barrier.

11.description: Capitol television crews who film the tribute interviews and arena coverage for broadcast.
Various servants and staff who work in the Training Center and Capitol buildings.

17.description: Small device from the Cornucopia that can be hammered into trees to extract fresh water.

16.description: Coil of wire from the Cornucopia that Beetee plans to use in his electrical trap.

26.description: Used to channel lightning into the force field, causing the arena to collapse.

16.description: Alliance of Career tributes from Districts 1 and 2 who control the Cornucopia in the Quarter Quell.

17.description: Alliance formed between Katniss, Peeta, Finnick, and others to survive the Quarter Quell.

22.description: Expands to include Beetee, Wiress, and Johanna as they work together against the Careers.

16.description: Cannon that fires to announce the death of each tribute in the Quarter Quell arena.

17.description: Gifts sent to tributes via parachute from sponsors in the Capitol during the Games.

24.description: Include bread from District 3 that serves as a secret message from the rebellion.

22.description: The arena is divided into 12 sections like a clock, each with different hourly threats.

1.description: Person mentioned in District 12 conversation, friend of Katniss and Gale.

8.description: Medical staff at the District 8 hospital who were bombed by the Capitol during the rebellion.
Injured rebels from District 8 who were being treated in the hospital before it was bombed.

4.description: High-ranking Peacekeepers who oversee operations in the districts during the unrest.

7.description: Wealthy Capitol citizens who attend President Snow's party where Katniss meets Plutarch.

2.description: The mayors of all districts who must host Victory Tour ceremonies and maintain order.

11.description: Capitol escorts assigned to guide and present the Quarter Quell tributes, similar to Effie.

17.description: Natural animals and birds living in the arena jungle, separate from the engineered mutts.
Various plants in the arena jungle, some edible and others potentially dangerous.

1.description: Coal miners who work in the dangerous mines of District 12, mostly from the Seam.
Wealthier citizens of District 12 who own shops and businesses, including the bakery.

2.description: Capitol employees who operate and staff the luxurious train during the Victory Tour.

13.description: Capitol citizens who watch the Quarter Quell interviews and Games broadcasts.

14.description: Show unprecedented emotion and opposition to the Quarter Quell after Peeta's pregnancy announcement.

27.description: Leadership of the supposedly destroyed District 13 who are revealed to be alive and leading the rebellion.

24.description: Beetee's strategy to use the arena's lightning and wire to electrocute the remaining Career tributes.

1.description: President Snow's various threats and intimidation tactics against Katniss and her loved ones.
Various symbols of resistance including the mockingjay pin and three-finger salute.

2.description: Enhanced security forces deployed during the Victory Tour to prevent uprising.

1.description: Katniss's deceased father who died in a mine explosion, taught her to hunt and sing.

3.description: Deceased tribute from District 11 who Katniss allied with and mourns during the Victory Tour.
Deceased tribute from District 11 who spared Katniss in the first Games, honored during Victory Tour.

2.description: Various local officials in each district who coordinate with the Capitol and manage local affairs.

7.description: Security forces protecting Capitol buildings and officials, including President Snow.

17.description: Fish living in the arena's saltwater that Finnick catches for food using his trident.
Shellfish found in the arena waters that provide additional food for the tributes.

18.description: Edible nuts found in the arena jungle that Katniss identifies as safe to eat.
Edible roots found in the arena jungle that provide sustenance for the tributes.

8.description: Districts that have begun to rebel against the Capitol, starting with District 8.

9.description: Historical record of previous Quarter Quells, including the 25th and 50th Games with special rules.

8.description: Soup seller at the Hob in District 12.

1.description: Mayor's daughter and Katniss's friend, who gave her the mockingjay pin.
Mayor of District 12, father to Madge and politically careful.
Mayor's wife, mother to Madge, suffers from headaches and takes medicine.

11.description: Member of Katniss's prep team, orange-skinned man who styles her hair.
Member of Katniss's prep team with aqua hair and gold tattoos above her eyebrows.
Member of Katniss's prep team, plump woman with pea-green skin who does nails.

7.description: Young girl at President Snow's party who admires Katniss's mockingjay dress.

13.description: Famous Capitol television host who interviews the tributes before the Games.

7.description: Former Head Gamemaker who was executed for allowing two victors in the 74th Games.

3.description: Elderly man in District 11 who whistles the mockingjay tune after Katniss's speech, then gives the three-finger salute before being shot.
Rue's mother, father and siblings who Katniss meets during the Victory Tour in District 11.
Thresh's grandmother and other family members who Katniss meets during the Victory Tour in District 11.
Brutal Peacekeepers who shoot the old man and maintain order during Katniss's visit to District 11.

2.description: Mayor of District 1 (luxury goods) who hosts Katniss and Peeta during their Victory Tour.
Mayor of District 2 (masonry/Peacekeepers) who participates in Victory Tour ceremonies.
Mayor of District 3 (technology) who participates in the Victory Tour ceremonies.
Mayor of District 4 (fishing) who hosts Katniss and Peeta during their Victory Tour stop.
Mayor of District 5 (power) who participates in Victory Tour events.
Mayor of District 6 (transportation) who hosts Victory Tour ceremonies.
Mayor of District 7 (lumber) who participates in the Victory Tour.
Mayor of District 8 (textiles) who greets Katniss and Peeta during their Victory Tour.
Mayor of District 9 (grain) who hosts Victory Tour events.
Mayor of District 10 (livestock) who participates in Victory Tour ceremonies.

3.description: Mayor of District 11 (agriculture) who hosts the tense Victory Tour stop where the uprising begins.

7.description: Wealthy, fashion-obsessed citizens of the Capitol who attend parties and events.

14.description: React with shock and horror to Peeta's pregnancy announcement during the interviews.

15.description: Tongueless servants in the Training Center, including Darius who was turned into one.
Capitol officials who design and control the Quarter Quell arena under Plutarch's direction.

11.description: Capitol employees who run the Training Center and assist tributes before the Quarter Quell.

8.description: Citizens of District 8 who rose up in rebellion against the Capitol, later bombed in the hospital.

27.description: Citizens of the supposedly destroyed District 13 who are revealed to be alive and organizing the rebellion.
District 13 rebels who pilot the hovercraft that rescues Katniss from the destroyed arena.

19.description: Genetically engineered creatures created by the Gamemakers, including aggressive monkey mutts in the jungle.

24.description: Jabberjays that replay the screams of loved ones to torture the tributes.

16.description: Weapons and supplies stored in the Cornucopia at the center of the Quarter Quell arena.

recaps.1: President Snow visits Katniss unexpectedly, threatening her and her loved ones unless she convinces the districts that her love for Peeta is real.
recaps.2: Katniss begins the Victory Tour with Peeta, trying to follow Snow's demands while witnessing growing unrest in the districts.
recaps.3: The Victory Tour continues through Districts 11 and 8, where Katniss sees signs of rebellion and brutality from Peacekeepers.
recaps.4: Katniss returns to District 12 to find new Head Peacekeeper Thread implementing harsher rules and public punishment.
recaps.5: Gale is publicly whipped for poaching, and Katniss realizes the Capitol is tightening its grip on all the districts.
recaps.6: The fence around District 12 is electrified, cutting off Katniss's hunting grounds and escape route to the woods.
recaps.7: Katniss meets new Head Gamemaker Plutarch Heavensbee at President Snow's party and sees his mockingjay watch.
recaps.8: District 8 erupts in open rebellion, with Peacekeepers bombing the hospital where Katniss secretly filmed a propo.
recaps.9: Katniss learns about previous Quarter Quells and their special rules designed to remind citizens of the Capitol's power.
recaps.10: The Third Quarter Quell is announced: tributes will be reaped from the existing pool of victors in each district.
recaps.11: Katniss volunteers to replace Annie Cresta and reunites with Peeta and Haymitch to prepare for the Games.
recaps.12: Training begins in the Capitol, where Katniss meets the other victors and begins forming alliances.
recaps.13: Katniss interviews with Caesar Flickerman, wearing Cinna's mockingjay dress that transforms and symbolizes rebellion.
recaps.14: Peeta announces that he and Katniss are secretly married and that she's pregnant, shocking the Capitol audience.
recaps.15: Cinna is brutally beaten in front of Katniss before she enters the arena, and she's launched into the Quarter Quell.
recaps.16: Katniss finds herself on a small island with the Cornucopia surrounded by water and deadly tributes.
recaps.17: Katniss allies with Finnick and Mags, moving away from the Careers and into the jungle arena.
recaps.18: The alliance faces poisonous fog that burns their skin, and Mags sacrifices herself so the others can escape.
recaps.19: Katniss, Peeta, and Finnick recover from their injuries and encounter aggressive monkey mutts in the jungle.
recaps.20: The female morphling dies protecting Peeta from the monkey mutts, and the group seeks water and shelter.
recaps.21: Blight dies hitting the force field, and Katniss begins to understand the arena is designed like a clock with different horrors.
recaps.22: Katniss, Peeta, and Finnick meet up with Johanna, Beetee, and Wiress, who reveals the arena's clock pattern.
recaps.23: The Careers attack and Wiress is killed, but the alliance uses the clock knowledge to avoid the arena's deadly sections.
recaps.24: Beetee devises a plan to electrocute the remaining Careers using the lightning that strikes the arena at midnight.
recaps.25: The plan goes awry when Johanna and Katniss are separated, and Katniss is attacked by Brutus and Enobaria.
recaps.26: Katniss shoots her arrow at the force field, causing the arena to explode and destroying the Quarter Quell.
recaps.27: Katniss wakes up to find she's been rescued by District 13, but Peeta has been captured by the Capitol.
